events.message: The insured filed a claim reporting a car accident that occurred on March 30th involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report mentioning vehicle damage and collision details.
An agent was assigned to the case to facilitate communication and manage the claim process moving forward.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the claimant that the investigation would begin promptly.
The claimant was requested to submit photographs of the damaged vehicle, police report, and medical bills related to the accident injuries.
The claimant submitted all requested documents, including detailed photos of vehicle damage and copies of the official police accident report.
The investigation team began reviewing the submitted documents and scheduled an on-site inspection of the vehicle damages.
Investigation concluded with confirmation of the collision damages matching the claimant’s descriptions and police report.
A settlement was proposed to cover repair costs and medical expenses, based on the investigation findings and policy limits.
The claimant provided positive feedback on the prompt communication and clarity of the proposed settlement offer.
The claim was formally approved by the claims manager, confirming agreement on the compensation amount to be paid.
The insurer processed and issued the payment to the claimant’s bank account covering all approved costs of the accident.
Following payment, the claim was officially closed with all documentation archived and no outstanding issues reported.
